pros: Flexible hours with a great pay rate.
cons: Not Applicable in this current context.

pros:
Reasonable pay
CEUs provided during shift
Rarely required to stay past end of shift
cons:
Management
Assigned too many complex patients only at times
Pressure to be charge nurse, and told not to bring in on-call staff until after nurses are given too many patients
Put on call or laid off when patient censuses are low

job_title: Behavioral Health RN in Birmingham, AL
cons: Horrible place,with a very angry staff
employee parking at bottom of hill

pros: my co-workers are wonderful, but that is not surprising, nurses are some of the friendliest, funniest and supportive people you will every meet.
cons:
the dominate theme seems to be, if there is a problem, punish the nurses. they seem to think that that fixes everything. 

we usually have 5-6 patients and frequently no or only one PCA. so we are doing our jobs plus the PCA's job. we are constantly load with more and more thing that they want us to do, and criticized for not doing more, when we are running around like our hair is on fire already. 

as a nurse, there is no sense that upper management is on your side. we are treated like we are replaceable and unimportant. as some one who prides herself in being a hard worker, i've always felt like a valued worker wherever i have worked. this is the first time i have not been treated like i'm valued. 

my loyalty is to my co-workers because things get harder for us when people leave, but the adversarial attitude of upper management makes it uncomfortable to work there at times i'm not sure i'll be able to stay another year.

the health insurance is just awful.

pros:
As an employee and a patient while having my daughter, I enjoyed this company above many others.  There was plenty of staff in the event that you required day or more off, management very flexible with staff requesting schedule changes, and very knowledgeable staff  (another positive for schedule changes).  I must include the medical staff.  All of the surgeons that I worked with and came in contact with were EXCELLENT!!  At times people think that doctors are intimidating.  The surgeons at BWMC were approachable, caring, and very personable.  To this day I still think of and miss this amazing group of physicians and staff. 
As I began labor pains in surgery, I quickly  transitioned into a patient.  As a patient with my only child I didn't know what to expect.   My L&D nurse was supreme.  She went above and beyond.  
It's all good at the Wood!!
cons: With my tenure of 17+ years of working in surgery, at this time I cannot think of a con for BMC OR.

pros: They have great staff in the education department that try to assist in helping new nurse grads. Great food at night with great staff in the kitchen.
cons: When it comes time to fulfill their obligation for their staff and keep their word for what they promise for their employees they fail. Their ethics are not any good and are not good for their new grads or new nurses and this in turn causes a high turn over rate and many unhappy employees. Patients are not happy with treatment  due to all what is going on and if change does not take place with higher management this will cause this organization to fail.

review_title: Horrible upper management and keeps getting worse.
pros: The worker bees have a close relationship. They stick together and help each other. The staff is friendly and do things for one another.
cons: Horrible pay. Upper management only worry about the money. Only hire new grads to save money. Management will throw you under the bus. The turnover rate is horrible. If they are ready to fire you they will find a reason.

pros: Pick your own schedule. Pay is matched with surrounding hospitals. Free parking. I like my patient population. Time and a half for 36+ hours. Encourage advancing education.
cons: Chronic understaffing. Broken/unavailable equipment. Mandatory overtimes. Unavailable management. Place needs upgraded.

pros: Coworkers are nice and management is willing to help you with personal needs as in time off or work around school schedule.
cons: Pay is extremely low. You are taking on a lot of work and the pay does not come close to all the responsibilities. Other hospitals pay way more.

pros: Friendly staff and pay is ok, but not great.
cons: Some areas of the hospital could use some major updates

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Birmingham, AL
pros: Good co workers, good pay. Cheap benefits
cons: Management sucks. It's too many people paying the boss. They pass your problems on to each other. So there's no accountability in the psych department. Rules change by the day.

pros: Family oriented,new research, New Women's Center, robotics.
cons: Too many layoffs! Rather than relocating the displaced workers they are laid off often without any notice regardless of tenure.

pros: Pay scale is good in this area
cons: Lack of staff to safely run a psy unit
